meanings.definition: A person who writes literary or journalistic works for someone else who is named as the author.
meanings.sent1: The ghostwriters helped the famous author write his new book.
meanings.sent2: Many bestsellers are actually written by ghostwriters.
meanings.sent3: The ghostwriters decided to play a prank by signing their own names on the book cover.
meanings.sent4: In the literary world, ghostwriters are like invisible collaborators.
meanings.sent5: The role of ghostwriters is often overlooked but crucial in the publishing industry.

meanings.definition: To write (a literary or journalistic work) for someone else who is named as the author.
meanings.sent1: She ghostwrites articles for busy executives who lack time to write.
meanings.sent2: Authors sometimes hire ghostwriters to help with their workload.
meanings.sent3: The novelist decided to ghostwrite a memoir for a retired astronaut.
meanings.sent4: Ghostwriting requires skill in capturing the voice of the credited author.
meanings.sent5: He was asked to ghostwrite a screenplay based on a true story.
